p: Certain studies have shown that there is no support or evidence to cure the disease solely via pharmaceutical means. Globally, measures have been taken to delay or even prevent the disease. However, a few studies have shown inconsistent results. Epidemiologically, various studies have suggested that several factors, such as the intellectual activities, diet, and cardiovascular risk factors, can be modified to delay the development of AD. Notwithstanding, clinical evidence is pending to conclude if the above can really help control AD occurrence. Yet, AD remains associated with very high-risk factors such as hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, smoking, and diabetes, which may worsen the course of the diseaseÂ [ 36].
